title: Quenching of the ion/vortex-ring transition in He II by intense electric fields.
abstract: The rate nu at which negative ions nucleate charged vortex rings in isotopically pure superfluid helium-4 has been measured for electric fields of up to 2.5 x 10^6 V/m with pressures and temperatures within 17 < P < 25 bars, 0.3 < T < 0.9 K. It is found that the nucleation process is completely quenched (nu = 0) for E > 2 x 10^6 V/m. The implications of this result for theories of the nucleation mechanism are discussed

        Quenching of the ion/vortex-ring transition in He II by intense electric fields.</dc:title><dc:creator>
        Nancolas, G. G.</dc:creator><dc:creator>
        McClintock, Peter V. E.</dc:creator><dc:subject>
        QC Physics</dc:subject><dc:description>
        The rate nu at which negative ions nucleate charged vortex rings in isotopically pure superfluid helium-4 has been measured for electric fields of up to 2.5 x 10^6 V/m with pressures and temperatures within 17 < P < 25 bars, 0.3 < T < 0.9 K. It is found that the nucleation process is completely quenched (nu = 0) for E > 2 x 10^6 V/m. The implications of this result for theories of the nucleation mechanism are discussed.</dc:description><dc:date>

        http://dx.doi.org/10.1103/PhysRevLett.48.1190</dc:relation><dc:identifier>
        Nancolas, G. G. and McClintock, Peter V. E. (1982) Quenching of the ion/vortex-ring transition in He II by intense electric fields. Physical Review Letters, 48 (17). pp. 1190-1192. ISSN 1079-7114</dc:identifier><dc:relation>
